Literature Review: The study of RNA modifications in plants has gained significant momentum over the past decade, driven by advancements in high-throughput sequencing technologies and the growing recognition of the functional importance of these modifications. RNA modifications, including those found in messenger RNAs (mRNAs), ribosomal RNAs (rRNAs), and transfer RNAs (tRNAs), play crucial roles in various biological processes, from basic cellular functions to complex organismal responses. This literature review aims to summarize the current understanding of the diversity and functions of RNA modifications in plants, highlighting key findings and future directions in the field.
